subtitle: Your baby loves to play
title: 3 months old
content:
Your baby is getting more flexible. He may enjoy opening and closing his
fingers, or clapping his hands. Your baby's sense of humour is developing,
too. A tickle or a noisy kiss on his tummy is likely to make him chuckle.
Right from birth, your baby loves to be touched. It's important for his growth
and development. About now, different textures will start to interest your
baby As he starts to understand the world, just playing helps your baby's
brain to grow. As his brain develops, he is getting more curious. He may play
with a small toy that he can hold and shake about. He will be learning about
colour, shape and size, too. He also learns from the noise a toy makes and
from feeling if it is soft or hard. At this age, if he is on his belly, he may
lift up his head and shoulders, using his arms for support. Your baby may even
be able to roll over from his front to his back. Encourage him by jiggling a
toy on the side he usually rolls to. Clap and smile when he does! created by
BabyCentre
